Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit a game-tying home run in the first inning.
The Dodgers rallied twice from early deficits to win 7-5.
Teoscar Hernández’s single brought home Ohtani and Betts to give the Dodgers a lead they wouldn’t surrender.
The Dodgers achieved their first postseason game lead since Game 4 of the NLDS against the Padres.
Post-Match Reflections: Dave Roberts emphasized the importance of fighting back and praised the team's resilience.
Freddie Freeman highlighted the impact of having Shohei Ohtani on the team.
Max Muncy noted the significant boost Ohtani provided to the team and the stadium.
Shohei Ohtani expressed his enjoyment of the moment and his ability to perform under pressure.
Dave Roberts reflected on Ohtani's unique talent and ability to carry the team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers' bullpen delivered six scoreless innings.
Shohei Ohtani is on a 13-game hitting streak and has collected hits in 14 of his last 17 at-bats with runners in scoring position.
